docs.text: titantic , writer and director james cameron's much anticipated and sometimes ridiculed $200 , 000 , 000 epic , arrives shortly into the theaters so the question naturally arises , whether the film is worth it ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a business proposition , it seems hard to see how it can ever break even , but as a movie it is nothing short of wonderful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you've already neatly categorized it as yet another disaster movie a la volcano or the poseidon adventure , think again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is both a great love story told with the disaster as a backdrop and a portrayal of one of the world's most memorable disasters made real and personal by seeing it through the eyes of two young lovers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in either case , it is filmmaking at its best .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when we entered the press screening , my wife asked the publicity rep if there would be an intermission since the film runs three and a quarter hours long .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he said no but that the time would go by so fast she'd never notice the length .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: amazingly , he was right .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: titanic is one of the few long films that doesn't suffer because of it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the lush picture , filmed by russell carpenter in 70mm , opens in the present with two diving subs exploring the wreck of the titanic on the bottom of the ocean .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fortune hunter brock lovett ( bill paxton ) leads the expedition looking for the world's most valuable diamond necklace that went down with the ship , known back then as " the ship of dreams . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the necklace's hundred-year-old former owner , rose dewitt bukater ( gloria stuart ) , finds brock to tell him her story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although almost all of the movie happens in flashback , one of the engineers shows the elderly rose exactly how the ship was sunk .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: using a computer simulation , the movie takes the time to explain what will happen later , which adds immensely to making a lucid story out of what would have otherwise been hopelessly confusing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after twenty minutes , the story makes its jump to the past as the titanic leaves on her maiden voyage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a classic movie theme , the two parts of the ship , first class and steerage ( third-class ) exist in sharp contrast .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the strength of the script is the way it paints the differences between rich and poor without excessive moralizing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: entering the ship on its day out is rose along with her millionaire fiance , cal hockley , played with perfect snobbishness by billy zane .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and thanks to a last minute winning poker hand , an itinerant artist named jack dawson gets himself into a little shared cabin in third class .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even with her own promenade deck , rose feels trapped on the ship , what with an upcoming marriage to a man she loathes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in contrast , jack can barely contain his euphoria at being on board .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after jack saves rose from committing suicide , they start a brief but impassioned love affair .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: never tawdry and rarely explicit , their romance has the power to sweep the audience into the story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: leonardo dicaprio in his best performance ever plays jack with confidence and charisma .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in so many ways , small and large , he makes all the right decisions in his approach to the part .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he confronts cal , for example , he remains composed and polite and yet subtly undermines every one of cal's supercilious put-downs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate winslet gives a wonderfully captivating performance as young rose .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the chemistry between these two academy award nominees , him for what's eating gilbert grape and her for sense and sensibility , is nothing short of astonishing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the scene where he embarrasses her by repeatedly asking if she loves her finace to the beautiful one of them hanging off the ship's bow to the one where she embarrasses him by asking him to paint her nude , they dazzle the screen with a pair of mesmerizing performances .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if the film breaks after an hour and a half , which is how long cameron wisely waits to have the iceberg show up , you will still get one of the best films of the year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: peter lamont's sets are more than authentic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one scene , for example , starts with the planning-to-retire captain , played with insouciance by bernard hill , having his tea on deck .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it then shifts to the ship's massive gears and then to the bright-hot boiler room filled with sweating muscular men shoveling in the coals .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the handsome interior common rooms of the ship resemble a palace more than an ocean liner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: easily the most fascinating part of the story is what happens after the iceberg hits and before the battle with the water begins in earnest .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at first , since the iceberg tears a series of little gashes in the hull , not some big gaping hole , the passengers view the hit as more of curiosity than anything else .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what a lark .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we've struck an iceberg .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now let's get back to our brandy and cigars .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the ship's musicians play like troopers through it all , even after the panic sets in .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after all , they see it as their duty to calm the passengers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the musicians are about to die , they politely thank each other for the pleasure of being able to play together , and they mean it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: their civility borders on insanity , but it is touching nevertheless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story is so rich that my description has merely touched the surface .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are more than enough characters to love and to hate , and all of the casting is dead-on .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: special effects work best when their presence becomes almost undetectable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in titanic , for which he created a nine-tenths scale model of the entire ship , cameron strove for accuracy at all costs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the most dramatic moment in the film happens when the ship breaks in two , and the front section becomes vertical in the water .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: people are flung like ants either into the water to be shortly frozen to death or into other parts of the ship to be crushed immediately .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besides being romantic and dramatic , the script includes liberal doses of humor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the many deliciously subtle verbal put-downs to the physical comedy , as when jack teaches rose to spit like a man , the show elicits laughter in addition to perhaps a few tears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " it's good-bye for a little while , " a less than confident father tells his little girl since it was indeed women and children first .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " this boat's for mommies and children .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there'll be a boat in a little while for daddies . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: basically there was a design decision to have fewer than half of the necessary life boats -- it made the decks look too crowded otherwise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps the sinking is best summarized by one of the guggenheim's on-board the ship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the dining room with the lifeboats gone and the ship certain to sink , he is offered a life jacket by one of the crew .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " no thanks , " the elegantly attired guggenheim replies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " we're dressed in our best and would prefer to go down like gentlemen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but we would like a brandy . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: titanic runs 3 : 14 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is rated pg-13 for tastefully and delicately presented sex and nudity and would be fine for kids twelve and up .
docs.label: positive
